website_summaries.verdict: A great option for enthusiastic climbers, this extra tall 2-tiered cat tree mounts to the wall for added stability. Solid quality for a reasonable price.
pros: Sturdy construction is ideal for heavy felines
Provides plenty of climbing space and an appropriate outlet for scratching
Features 2 solid wood platforms with removable padding for cats to perch, lounge, or sleep on
Fixes to walls for superior stability, even during rough play
cons: Because the base remains on the floor, it does have a small footprint

customer_reviews.title: Cats Need To Climb!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rather shy nervous cat with Feline Hyperesthesia Syndrome. This tree has turned him into the happiest cat on earth (almost). I wish I bought this years ago. Cats need to climb and hunt. This provides it all!
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic climbing post!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic climbing post; very sturdy; the cats took to it right away (they actually started climbing while I was putting it together). It took a little while for them to figure out how to get down from the top shelf but after a few days they were good. This also works well as a fun addition to a cat activity wall (with various placed shelves and such). Would highly recommend for those active cats who love to climb! Only took about 20 minutes to install by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Roy

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, sturdy, much more attractive than usual cat trees, and functional! Our 13 lb cat took a few days to get used to it (he didn’t like the straight alignment of holes at first) and the top platform is a bit small, but now he confidently climbs through both holes to the top. My only other feedback is that the middle platform should stick out a bit further from the top platform so they have sufficient landing space to jump from the top. Our cat currently can’t do that. He hops onto the adjacent windowsill instead to get down. It is good that they sell replacement posts!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Popcorn

customer_reviews.title: Best cat perch purchase ever made!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 yr old boy cat loves to climb and jump! Find him on top of the fridge, trying to climb walls to get to shelves, pictures- he will even try to climb on me- so this is absolutely perfect! He’s been purring and playing on it since I got the first shelf assembled! He loves it! It’s really sturdy too and looks so much better than the other climbers. My cat has had no problem climbing up or climbing down.
customer_reviews.author: LisaD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cat Tree
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cat tree. It was easy to set up and was made of high quality wood. I bought this because other cat trees get matted with cat fur and are uncleanable. This one is great. The fur can only stick to the little beds which are removable and washable. I think it's prettier than most trees. It's also very secure (screws into the wall). The spacing between the levels is pretty big and at first I was worried, but my cats seem to love it, since they have to climb the sisal to get up.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for climbing up! A little harder to come down.
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice ! It is sturdy, attractive. My kitten just loves it ! My heavier less active cat finds it hard to jump down from. It is quite a jump. I have it next to my entertainment center so from the top they can jump to the entertainment center and then to the first shelf but as I said my heavier cat finds it a little frightening.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Tom

customer_reviews.title: looks beautiful but instructions were missing
customer_reviews.text: very nice but it had a part missing as well as the instructions...it was easy enough to figure it out for most part but i had to take apart because i wasn't aware it attached to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Deise

customer_reviews.title: Cats are fans! Sturdy and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put up, very stable, anchoring into dry wall was easy especially with the parts provided. Cats started using the scratch post while I was putting the unit together. I have a climber who has already made it to the top, and another jumper who has jumped onto the second platform multiple times. Very happy with my purchase!! Someone asked about chemical smells - none at all. The sisal was a little scratchy (as expected) so I made sure to be careful when attaching them.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: So stylish!
customer_reviews.text: After going through a huge, 6-foot, 5 cubbie kitty tree, I wanted something tall for my cats but less bulky. The two perches on this cat tree are right-sized... both kitties love to climb, nibble on dry food I place up on the stands, and nap on the soft pads. HIGH quality construction, very solid and easy to assemble. The sissal rope around the tree lasts a long time... we've had the tree three months and it barely shows any wear/tearing, even with two cats who use it every day! Glad to know they sell replacement sissal posts for this tree, too. WORTH the money, it takes up less space than your average kitty condo and looks stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase...
customer_reviews.text: Great cat climber. I was surprised by the size and weight of the package. It's made of good quality materials. Cats seem to love it. Nreds to we attached to the wall studs in order to support the weight of the cats as they climb.
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Arauz

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, high quality cat scratcher/perch! I do agree that some cats can have a hard time jumping down from the top tier to the middle to get off, and although my cat doesn't quite have those problems, I do plan to hook up a few cat runways and sisal poles to the top tier so it has a few options to get down
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great wall mounted super tall cat tree
customer_reviews.text: Great cat tree. wall screws more than sufficient to securely anchor the cat tree. no wobbling. The levels can be adjusted, instead of putting one half and one on top, put one 3/4 up and one on top. Perfect for cat to jump from desk to cat tree to perch. Top level is small, best for smaller cats Comes with two very soft sleeping pads, one medium size for the lower level and a small size for upper level. Held firm with good adhesive using hook and loop (velco) so is stable on tree but removal for wash wood and scratching posts good quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned it. Unstable and too big for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My 13 pound cat had a hard time jumping off from the top when I carried him and put him on the top shelf. He only used the bottom shelf bc he could t reach the top one.
customer_reviews.author: H.C.

customer_reviews.title: Non-reviewer impressed enough to review
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to write reviews. I am so impressed by this product! I could hardly get it put together without my 9 month kitten climbing the posts and jumping on the shelves. She is 9ish pounds and has no problem climbing. I installed near my couch because it fit best and also provides additional places for her to jump. The assembly was easy and straightforward. I was concerned about attaching to the wall but there were no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Beckasus

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it!
customer_reviews.text: The kitties were perched on top of it before I finished installing it! The directions are unusually well-written, making installation relatively easy. I wrapped part of the top perch in rope because when one kitty tried to climb up top, she slipped off. The rope solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Micro

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product! Great for large cats.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It was easy to assemble, about 5 minutes total time. It anchors to the wall at both platforms, so it is very sturdy. The posts are wrapped very well. My 15lb and 18lb cats have been scratching and been up and down this cat tree for 2 months and it shows no signs of wear whatsoever. I wasn't sure they'd use it at first, but within the first 2 days they were all over it. If your cat is declawed, this may not be a good choice. Even though my cats can jump to the lower platform, they need to climb to the top platform.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best scratching post ever
customer_reviews.text: My little dude already loved his short scratching post and he climbed up it when he got the zoomies, but it's not tall enough for him to go very far. This one is exactly what he loves: lots of scratching and climbing as well as various platforms for him to nap, eat catnip, and watch birds he wants to eat out the window. I had some trouble anchoring it to the wall because the building is more than a century old and the walls are uneven, but I figured it out. He's about 12 lbs, for reference.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fandl

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes to perch near me when I'm working at my desk. This is the perfect way for her to be close and not on top of me or the computer. She's a rescue, and 7, so the concept of climbing is foreign to her (I think). Looks like I'm going to have to teach her to climb. Easy instructions to follow. My husband and I had it put together in about 20 min from start to finish (including making sure the shelves were level).
customer_reviews.author: Martha S.

customer_reviews.title: Mounts to wall, very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice looking, stable once it is mounted to the wall. My only issue is that the top platform is so far from the middle one. My cats aren’t huge, full grown at 7 and 9 lbs. I feel like I need to add a shelf or something, they just hesitate so much when they are trying to get down. I’ll even get a little meow “help” if they hesitate too long. Maybe they will figure it out eventually. Other than that it’s a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Needs one more platform
customer_reviews.text: My climbers are actually struggling a little bit, and one climbs ladders resting against a wall (or even up the back of the ladder for a challenge)! We do have it secured but it still makes shifting noises if it's jumped onto (like from the couch a few feet away). Mostly it's just that the platforms are VERY far apart. Once we installed "steps" between mine were super-happy. If it had had 3 platforms instead of 2 I think it would've been perfect out of the box. They did really love the ability to completely stretch out while scratching, so that was a big win.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful  product!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is fantastic and my kitten loves it! The platforms are very sturdy and the hardware is made of a metal, no plastic, and that is including the drywall anchors. My only complaint is that it is difficult for my kitten to get down from the top as the shelving is not staggered enough, nor close enough for him to jump. He is learning how to though and uses a floating shelf we have up as a step. Otherwise this is a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible Assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is amazingly DIFFICULT to assemble. There are many many screws and other little dodads. The instructions are not easy to read. We had the pieces on our couch for weeks before we just gave up and put a bunch of weights on the base. The top is still wobbly. The cat will have to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Spinner

customer_reviews.title: Lacking practical magic
customer_reviews.text: Arrived late actually but looks just like it’s pictured. Installation is fairly simple but assembly can be a bit tedious. Taller than I expected but that’s not a bad thing. It’s fairly sturdy once latched into the wall however my cat doesn't Use it all too much ... she likes the sisal part of it but she doesn’t dare use them for climbing... especially not through the openings they are suppose to enter in. The wood is so cold and slippery on their paws there’s no where to grip safely which I believe is the reason my cat doesn’t use it as much not even to nap in. Looks good in theory but not practical.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Lorénz

customer_reviews.title: Posts need replacing after a week
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats, two older all three under 15 lbs and there's no way this thing would have remained standing with what they give you with it. Even in a stud. I had to reinforce the entire thing with L brackets to the two sides abutted the corners, plus bolted it to the floor. Now a week later both posts have to be replaced. These are housecats - they've never even been outside. I had floating shelves up before and this was supposed to replace those. that had withstood 10 years. I should have left well enough alone. This might be okay for kittens, but full gown cats? I guess it depends on the cats.
customer_reviews.author: David Lohmeier

customer_reviews.title: Top ledge is comically small
customer_reviews.text: Well made, attractive, easy enough to assemble. DEFINITELY need to bolt this into the wall. The top ledge is too small. Granted, my cat is curvy (about 16.5lbs), so this might not be a concern for everyone. He doesn’t seem to mind hanging over the edge, it just makes me nervous watching it. This easily could’ve been designed to be more accommodating to bigger cats since the hole to get up is bigger than the cushion. I assume these holes were made large with bigger cats in mind, which is ironic. Wish I could return this but my apartment walls are already ruined so I’ll just keep my fingers crossed for my cat’s safety!
customer_reviews.author: Grace Mc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Minimal
customer_reviews.text: The minimal design is great. My cat loves climbing this thing, but she has a hard time getting to the top level. She hasn't figured out how to climb through the hole, and she had trouble getting purchase over the ledge when climbing the other side. I think she'll figure it out eventually, but it might be nice is there were some more rope or something on the top ledge for her to sink her claws into.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Broken at bottom, must secure to wall
customer_reviews.text: The tree must be screwed to the wall (with mollies) into the wall (holes on the second tier to secure). The bottom piece snapped plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Cat Climber
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old cats. The capability to climb the center I think is good for cats who maybe already had tree, or enjoyed climbing up things. The top shelf has no other way for them to get up without climbing the center, so they don't use that shelf much. The middle one they can jump on easily from the ground, so that's the level they use most. Overall, really sturdy. Probably better for curious kittens and/or cats who really love climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Carla90

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: This cat tree is well made, easy to put together and looks nice. My old cat tree would shake back and forth when ever the cats got on it. This tree is as solid as a rock since it actually screws into the wall. My only criticism of the design is that there is no material for the cats to grab onto when going thru the holes on the platform. Even though they have figured it out, it would be beter if there was an area of sisal or carpet on the platforms.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to try to dissuade our cats from scratching our furniture, and its working! Its engaging and seems satisfying for their scratching and climbing needs. We've had it up for 3 weeks and they are now climbing all the way to the top. However, they are hopping down to a nearby waist level piece of furniture, not down to the middle platform. I think perceptually they find that hop down too vertical. Assembly: Easy to put together, can do with 1 person, easier with 2nd person to be available at times. I wish we had 1 more scratching pole on top of the top platform to maximize the cats climbing options.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your cat can jump high places easily
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn’t like it. He is very active loves to use scratching posts, however, he doesn’t like to use the holes to climb through and it’s quite a distance to get to the top landing. Even for our cat that jumps a high distance with no problem. It’s really just two pieces of wood anchored to the wall . No privacy for cats to curl up and nap without being out in the open. Not what we expected. A bit disappointed but it’s on the wall not much we can do now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, flexible configuration, cats love it - used as access to extended cat walk
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in the basement of my old house where all the felt and canvas-wrapped heating pipes are about 18 inches below the ceiling. I covered the pipes with cardboard (to protect the wrapping and the cats) and then installed the cat tree against an interior wall near the pipes. In no time at all my two girls scooted up the tree and began exploring their new cat walk. Now they hang out on different levels of the tree and bat at each other through the holes. Great investment. MEOW.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Zed

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, kitten loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a kitten who happens to be quite the climber. With limited space in my house, I was hardpressed to find something he could safely get on. This cat tree is excellent. Assembled it and attached it to the wall in less than 30 minutes and less than an hour later, the kitten was zooming up and down it. It's even sturdy enough for my 14 pound cat. No regrets on this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Rardon

customer_reviews.title: Cat and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this looks. My cat loves to climb it and hang out at the top. I assembled it with the larger center piece at the top so she would have more room to lay down. Didn't seem to cause any problems with the tower. My only complaint is that the drywall anchors that came with it slid right back out of the wall. Attempt number two they stayed in but not tight to the wall. Not secure. So I measured out the studs, marked it on the tower and made new holes the width of the studs. Now it's not going anywhere when my cat basically runs to the top!!
customer_reviews.author: Johnna Braden

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this thing! I frequently hear them scaling the beam and running and chasing each other up and down. They've made a bit of a racetrack between the couch, end table, other cat tower and this. I'm in a rental right now, so instead of screwing into the wall, I used four command velcro stickies (two on each shelf) and it holds like magic. Definitely need to secure to the wall, though, with the configuration as described.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Just Don’t buy USED
customer_reviews.text: Love the first one we bought New. But we tried to buy a second USED -“great condition, original box” for a lesser price hoping to save money, what arrived was the original box containing some other random cat tree. Which means somebody didn’t bother to check what was inside after accepting a return from another buyer who decided to keep the nice climber and return something else. Pretty disappointing. I haven’t bothered ordering a second new one. Really a pain to have to return a heavy object. Our original one that we purchased NEW is great quality, really nice looking and the cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tkhb

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This tree is a bit more expensive, but it much better quality than most of the other single column trees. I like that it ancors to the wall. Even our 17 lbs cat can play on it without it moving around or seems unstable. Our cats love the holes in the platforms to climb up and down, but also to mess with each other. We drilled a hole in the top platform so that we could hang toys for them to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Mer_Can

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: I wound up not using one of the scratching post sections. It was too tall for the spot I wanted to place it, but it doesn’t affect the sturdiness at all by not using a piece. My cats were instantly drawn to it which is a huge plus. Might have to do with the company supplying a pack of catnip in the box. Love the product so far, easy enough install, and heavy enough to not fear being tipped over.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Was glad individual pieces were available
customer_reviews.text: Needed a part to replace one broken in an existing cat tower. It was a component that required a single support so one worked well. Was sturdier than the piece it replaced. Size (length and with) were different from OEM parts so I would recommend if replacing one of several supporting legs on the same level, replace them all at the same time , or make sure to compare sizes before hand.
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and not ugly!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a cat tree that I’m not embarrassed to have in my house. I really like the design and it is so sturdy! I have a 15 lb. cat (pure muscle) and have no concerns about his safety at all! I had a little trouble mounting it to the wall, but would attribute that to “user error” more than an issue with the design. Because of that I had to change the design slightly (ahem.) Even my other cat who has previously shown no interest in cat trees climbs up now and then. In fact, he’s sitting on it while I write this!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Post
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this cat post. We took a couple of stars due to the issues with assembly. We did message petfusion on facebook but they didn't respond in time so we ended up moving where it was being installed. We also had to change how it was being installed due to some mislabled items. All in all it was a good purchase our cat loves climbing to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: LOW QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Pieces were missing. No instructions included. It was not nearly as sturdy as it should be considering its height and weight. This is my 5th cat tree i have purchased for my cats and this is the first i have ever returned.
customer_reviews.author: liza

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this climber!  Recommend purchasing this over a tower.
customer_reviews.text: the cat climber stands over 6 feet tall. The assembly instructions were concise and easy to understand and follow. It took me approximately 30 minutes total to assemble and install, using only a screw driver. Pay close attention to the instructions on installing the wall anchors to drywall, and you will have no problem with the anchors coming loose. If you follow the directions, it will secure very well to the wall. My cat took a couple of days to familiarize herself with the climber and now she confidently climbs all the way to the top. The materials are of good quality in this unit, and the company’s customer service is polite and attentive to any inquiries.
customer_reviews.author: RABECCA COLLIN

customer_reviews.title: Best cat tree I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble using a screwdriver, sturdy, and looks nice in the living room. It’s successfully stopped my cat from scratching the couch. My cat is 16ish pounds and when he climbs or jumps on it, the tree doesn’t move at all. My cat is a bit large and barely fits through the holes, but prefers to jump anyway. I’ll definitely recommend this to my friends with cats.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product! Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was super easy and the tower is super stable. No wobbling or imbalance. I recently got a Maine Coon kitten so we needed a tall and sturdy cat tree for him when he arrives. I have two other cats and they absolutely love climbing to the top and playing/sleeping on the platforms. This tree is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kipp

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - broke during assembly
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this cat tower, especially given the price point. Unfortunately, the plastic piece inside one of the tubes, where the screw goes, broke while we were assembling it so our cats never got to actually use it. My husband and I commented that we really expected higher quality for the price we paid. We promptly boxed it up to return. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Stone2008

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but the anchor screws were wrong
customer_reviews.text: The wall anchors it came with did not fit the screws it came with, resulting in blown out drywall. A day and a trip to home depot later for some toggle bolts and we were able to get it up and now it’s stylish and sturdy! Cats are slowly warming up to it, too! But seriously, don’t destroy your wall with the included anchors and screws- go to your local hardware store and get some heavy duty anchor sets of your own.
customer_reviews.author: Devan & Nina

customer_reviews.title: Great tower for an active cat!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2.5 year old cat loves this tower! He’s a climber and very active. The tower is very stable, sturdy, and easy to assemble. I watched the video instead of using the written directions which makes it self-explanatory. Definitely needs to be anchored to the wall, but it’s easy to do. I’ll probably move some furniture around and buy a 2nd one for another room.
customer_reviews.author: SMcQ

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it  ..make sure on install
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl loves this so much when I first installed it she was on it climbing playing scratching laying sleeping for a couple hours she was so happy I suggest making sure your attached in a wall stud I think it will loosen the dry wall holes after a while of use my top tier is not as stable as bottom which is in a stud
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed & pleasing to look at
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and secures well to the wall. Our cats weigh between 15 - 18 pounds each and the tree stays securely fastened when they climb unlike other free standing versions. It is also very unobtrusive when well placed even in a small area. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Carson

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and attractive
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this thing! They scramble up and down to look at the birds outside. It took a few days, but they eventually figured out how to get all the way to the top! I love the look of it and it's very sturdy due to being attached to the wall. The removable cushions are perfect for napping in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: southernsara

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: My cats always play there, they love it. I assembled by my self. Does not take a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: svitlana

customer_reviews.title: Total POS
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Wood too heavy to hold any weight, literally feel apart the first time my cat jumped on it. Tried modifying it by hanging extra supports from the ceiling - all we got was a bunch of holes in our walls/ceiling, a traumatized cat and a hit to our bank account.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for cat tree
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replacement part for your cat tree. Had to replace one of our "legs" on the cat tree to extreme use by the cats. This replacement part fits and works just great. Will buy again as other "legs" of the cat tree get torn up. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: dubbug

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it, and because you can ancho it to the wall, my heavier cats can actually really get a good stretch without it toppling over.
customer_reviews.author: deva

customer_reviews.title: Tiny top platform
customer_reviews.text: I like this overall. It's a bit slippery so my cat doesn't like it as well as I'd hoped. I should have attached the small platform in the center because he rarely goes to the top since he's a larger (longer) cat and doesn't feel safe up there. It assembles pretty easily and the instructions make sense.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaninCO

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Sleek and functional.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a few cat castles/condos over the years, and I wanted to get something a bit more... pleasing to the eye this time. It's a perfect fit for that, AND my kitties are happy. Love it. You DO need to attach it to the wall though -- not a free-standing climber.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Newman

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently adopted a kitten, and having a dog already, we knew there would be some tension. This super tall scratch post/tower is perfect! Our kitten likes to climb to the top, although he never goes all the way to the top perch. I think he is just scared though so we are looking into adding a shelf to assist him. The tower was pretty easy to put together as well! I would highly recommend this, especially if your cat needs a space to get away.
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and takes less space than a cat tree...
customer_reviews.text: A "tail" of two cats.......one of my young cats LOVES climbing the pole...the other will only scratch the lower pole and use a window seal to jump up on the first platform.....but I think the pole is great exercise for the one that uses it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough to anchor to wall
customer_reviews.text: Our two cats enjoy using this, even at the same time. Unfortunately, when our heavier cat (14lbs) climbs it, stress is added to the tower and the anchors become loose. We tried adding adhesive strips and the tower still wouldn’t remain anchored to the wall. Finally, the tower capsized and landed on furniture. This has been a very frustrating experience. We like the tower design and usability otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Some fraying but fun!
customer_reviews.text: A great indoor climbing tree for the rambunctious kitten, a little too narrow and tall for the Big Boy (13 years 21 lbs). The little one loves it so much, and scampers up all the time! A great way for her to expend energy and feel like a predator.
customer_reviews.author: Char, b. cool

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for climbers!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to put together. My cats LOVE climbing and this has kept their claws off of furniture. The only complaint I have is that the platforms would be better carpeted because they seem difficult for the cats to grab hold of while climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Britt

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre product
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the shelves arrived damaged. The sticky tape that is supposed to keep the padding adhered to the platforms is weak and if you have an active cat they aren't going to stay put. Mediocre product in particular because the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: I now have 3 happy cats
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. My cats love it and I don’t have to worry about them pulling it down off the wall. It is so sturdy. I have a Maine Coon and two other large cats. It’s wonderful for them to stretch while they scratch. They also like to use it to hop up on the ledge of my two-story window.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very Hard to get down
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not like this at all. The platforms are very far apart and he had trouble getting down from one to the next.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: They love it and it looks really nice
customer_reviews.text: It is screwed into the wall so it doesn’t budge when they race up and down it - I don’t think they find it comfortable to sleep on but they’re on and off it all day
customer_reviews.author: Christina Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Classy, functional and used daily.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten feels like she is queen of the jungle high on her perch. I have it tucked behind a ficus tree so it is not so noticeable. However, it is not ugly like the carpet cat trees. Now that we have a new puppy she can safely escape his desire to take a bite out of her.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Deaver

customer_reviews.title: Took my cats awhile to figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: Took my cats awhile to figure out how to climb up on to the platforms. Now they have and they love! Did not find it particularly easy to put together but fortunately have a friend who is good at this short of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall active cats
customer_reviews.text: My son already had one of these for his active Abyssinian cat. When we adopted a very large cat, we wanted to protect our furniture, so we decided to get one also. The cat took to this right away. Since he is very muscular, and heavy because of that, he was a bit scared of coming down from the top shelf. He has figured it out. We put it next to a window so he could enjoy the view from the shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but had to find another bolt.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made scratching post. I did have to find another mounting bolt at the store as the threads on this did not match the one I had, or any bolts I had in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: pogomaxx

customer_reviews.title: Sweet cat post!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of putting it together and how sturdy it is. My cats took to it right away and love it. It is one of the tallest I’ve been able to find. Super perfect for my kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Katlady2014

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ...battle tested...
customer_reviews.text: My 15lb Bengal jumps up and down all over this thing and it is very sturdy. I check it often and still tight as day one. Looks very nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.text: My psychos ( three wonderful cats 1-6) all love this thing and play on it constantly! I am looking forward to replacing one of the parts soon because I actually CAN instead of throwing away the entire thing! I LOVE that about this brand!!
customer_reviews.author: BaRodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats who like to climb up door frames
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my hyper-active lynx point Siamese cat. He loves to climb and would destroy the door frames by climbing up them. This tower is the perfect substitute, he loves climbing up in from the bottom all the way up to the top. It gives him a good work out when he gets those wild hairs. My other two cats enjoy the tower as well. It came very nicely packaged and it was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Rose

customer_reviews.title: Pleasing to the eye...
customer_reviews.text: Great cat tree! I love this cat tree...and so does my Bengal! :) Easy to assemble - did have a few knicks on the "wood" upon receipt. Came with catnip for the purr pads.
customer_reviews.author: GotButterflies

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: At first my cats had a hard time pulling themselves up onto the top platform and they seemed a little scared, but they still kept climbing up there. They also had trouble getting down at first, but once they figured it out, they’re unstoppable.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Cat is happy
customer_reviews.text: My youthful cat loves it. I haven’t even finished putting it up and he gravitated to it and hangs out on it.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Stable or Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a really good product that my cat loves. An issue thought that if it isn’t screwed into the wall it is pretty wobbly. Putting it in a different order than what is pictured makes it more stable, but in the end making holes in the walls is the safest option.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Cats were climbing on it before I could put it together fully!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clear directions. Easy to put together. Quality of materials is excellent.Kittens love it. Secured to the wall for safety and sturdiness. For the price, not a purchase you’ll regret.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing tower!
customer_reviews.text: Great cat tree! It's super sturdy, and screws into the studs for extra stability. The instructions were very clear & easy to follow. The company was nice enough to let us purchase some extra shelves, to customize it more for our cats. We also chose to use some carpet squares to cover the platforms rather than use the mats that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Benninger

customer_reviews.title: Great. Highly Recommend for Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this, and its fun to watch them run up this pole. This is such a cool cat tree for our small apartment. Definitely an excellent find - looks chic, too!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Abigail O

customer_reviews.title: Well made and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: The tree is well made and looks nice. I like the fact there isn’t any carpet that would eventually be shredded by my cats. It definitely needed to be attached to the wall since my cats aren’t small and would easily knock it over if not.
customer_reviews.author: cGill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Space
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tower that was tall enough to convince my cat that climbing the curtains was a bad idea. I also didn't want my cat to effectively take over the living room with a giant piece of furniture. This climbing tower met both of those needs. The reason I'm not giving five stars is because attaching it to the wall was a bit complicated for someone without "handyman" skills.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Cats love high places and this is a full 6’ tall! They will love it!
customer_reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with the great quality of this tower at such a low cost. It’s sturdy, great looking and our cat absolutely loves it! I highly recommend this! This purchase checked all the boxes!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hendry

customer_reviews.title: The big cat is happy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tall cat tree for my large cat to be able to stretch and cawl on. This is perfect for him!
customer_reviews.author: ttot

customer_reviews.title: Super well made, stable, and nice looking.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this tower - it's a great form of exercise for her and is great for her claws. The sissal posts can be replaced which is wonderful and the cat tower is attractive and free of the toxic carpet made in China that a lot of cat trees are covered in. She also loves sitting up really high and I feel better knowing how stable and secure the tower is. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Osmanski

customer_reviews.title: Best option for your cat, and probably for your feng shui.
customer_reviews.text: My guys love this, but I have two complaints: 1. The holes in the platforms are on the same side. 2. The price. I bought this because it's the kind of cat tree I wanted, and it's the only option. That being said, it looks exactly how it should, gives my kitten lots of height to climb, and it's not a disgusting carpeted monstrosity.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Its Puuuurrrrfect
customer_reviews.text: Our three cats love this new addition to our cat wall
customer_reviews.author: Mark Duenas

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and nice color wood
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of cat furniture. My only complaint is the cats never go up to the top level. I think the platform is top small and the hole isn't big enough to get through (big kitties).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it and cat tower looks great in the room
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it ! Perfect height for exercise and play. Match with my dark wood floor, looks good and well built. Easy to assemble and arrived on time !
customer_reviews.author: Dian Kartikasari

customer_reviews.title: Classy
customer_reviews.text: Not tacky at all like most pet/kid stuff! It's nice and tall. Had to have my husband anchor it for me (drilling holes in walls makes me nervous), but the way it's secured makes it very stable for the kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever for your cat!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this! My cat LOVES it! I put it together easily myself. He no longer scratches the furniture because he is obsessed with retrieving the toys I put on the top. He climbs and plays for hours. He even sleeps on the top perch. Yes it has to be attached to the wall but it's easy to do. This is the best purchase I've made for any cat in all the years I've had pets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love climbing the cat tree, and my husband loves the space saving and beauty of it. Everyone is happy. Easy to put together with extra helping hands.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Great cat tree!
customer_reviews.text: Out cats LOVE this cat tree! Very sturdy and well made!
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good cat pole.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to assemble. It looks great and it is sturdy even with my 15-20 lb cats. They love the rope and can fully stretch and scratch. My less agile cats do not venture to the top, but my smaller cats love the birds eye view of the living room.
customer_reviews.author: B. Watterson

customer_reviews.title: A great cat perch that is simple and fastens to the wall.
customer_reviews.text: That cat loves this. He has barely come off it since we put it together. I love that it doesn’t take up too much space an is simple looking. Would have preferred it in the corner by the window so the cat could look out side but there wasn’t a big enough wall space for it to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Frohlich

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and simple
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It’s easy to clean, my kitties love it and it looks beautiful
customer_reviews.author: lynxpointbaby

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today It’s made nice. I put it together myself My cat has not discovered it yet...but he will
customer_reviews.author: L. Gallen

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: Our little wild kitty loves climbing and scratching on this tower. He plays on it every day and it has held up well. He can stretch out and still has space to scratch. The best part is he no longer scratches our furniture!
customer_reviews.author: kwilson

customer_reviews.title: Great cat tower
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My kitten loves it! I like that is is clean in design -- not bulky and covered in carpet. It looks unobtrusive in our living room. I do wish the platforms were a little closer together.
customer_reviews.author: Julie R Cleveland

product_meta.title: PetFusion Ultimate Cat Climbing Tower & Activity Tree. (24 x 20.8 x 76.8 inches (lwh) Tall Sisal Scratching Posts, Modern Wall Mounted cat Furniture, Espresso Finish). 1 Year Manufacturer Warranty
product_meta.description: Size:Cat Climber| Color:EspressoDesigned for cats who love to climb and Perch up high. What cats don't? It's part of who they are. A better alternative to the over-engineered cat trees which clutter your living space and prevent your cat from climbing. That's what some cats believe curtains are now for. Easy assembly, 15-20 minute estimated total estimated Time. Includes zinc drywall anchors that can be attached to your wall with a hammer and screwdriver and also easily removed with just a screwdriver. No drilling required unless you prefer to anchor in studs or have plaster walls.
feature_bullets: INTERACTIVE DESIGN TO IMPROVE YOUR CAT'S WELLNESS: (I) For cats who love to climb & perch up high. (II) Great stimulation for young kittens & older cats. No age discrimination. (III) Stretch, scratch, jump, climb, perch, lounge & play
MODERN CAT FURNITURE: (I) Compared to the over-engineered cat trees which clutter your living space and actually limit your cat from climbing. That's what some cats believe curtains are now for : )

SAFETY FIRST EASY WALL MOUNTED ASSEMBLY: (I) Securely attaches to the wall providing a safe environment for your children and cat(s). (II) Includes zinc drywall anchors that can be attached to your wall with a hammer & screwdriver and also easily removed with just a screwdriver. No drilling required unless you prefer to anchor into studs or have plaster walls. (III) Estimate 15-20-minute total assembly time
PEACE OF MIND: (I) Premium E0 grade MDF passes formaldehyde safety regulations. (II) Product also passes stricter European REACH standards
YOU SHOULD NOW: (I) 24 x 20. 8 x 76. 8 inches (lwh). (II) Replacement posts available

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
